update.description:
depends on [ign-rendering pull request #165](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/165/ogre2-support-mouse-picking-for-objects/diff)

Added a new `transform_control` gui system that provides the gui buttons for changing between selection, translation, and rotation modes

Updated Scene3D to handle mouse events for selecting, translating, and moving models

Updated `user_commands` system to provide a service for pose commands.

TODO:

* ~~pass the PoseCmd component to the physics system and set the model pose there~~

content.raw: I just talked to @nkoenig and I'll revert this to send the request when the mouse is released even if still in a transform mode. This should address the usability issues @azeey and I were having. I'll see if I can prevent the empty command that is being sent when just selecting the model.

content.raw:
I recompiled `common`, `rendering` and `gazebo` with gcc and the error went away. Before I was using a mix of gcc and clang and the mesh manager singleton was different when creating the gizmo mesh and when retrieving it:

~~~
[GUI] [Dbg] [BaseGizmoVisual.hh:531]  MeshManager: 0x7fa568c55a10
[GUI] [Dbg] [MeshDescriptor.cc:53] MeshManager: 0x7fa57050f178
~~~

One of the error messages above was misleading. I made [a PR to ign-rendering](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/170/more-error-messages/diff) with some extra error messages.
content.html:
I recompiled common, rendering and gazebo with gcc and the error went away. Before I was using a mix of gcc and clang and the mesh manager singleton was different when creating the gizmo mesh and when retrieving it:

[GUI] [Dbg] [BaseGizmoVisual.hh:531]  MeshManager: 0x7fa568c55a10
[GUI] [Dbg] [MeshDescriptor.cc:53] MeshManager: 0x7fa57050f178

One of the error messages above was misleading. I made a PR to ign-rendering with some extra error messages.

content.raw: I'd expect this to be done on mouse release while still in one of the transform modes. That's how Gazebo classic does it. This ties to @azeey 's comment about translating and then selecting another model.
content.html: I'd expect this to be done on mouse release while still in one of the transform modes. That's how Gazebo classic does it. This ties to @azeey 's comment about translating and then selecting another model.

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Add support for moving and rotating models

content.raw:
Some comments which can be addressed in future PRs:

* The transform control button for the current mode should be checked
* The gizmo handles could be highlighed on hover for clarity
*  The mouse cursor could change to reflect the current tool (Gazebo classic doesn't do this though)
content.html:
Some comments which can be addressed in future PRs:

  • The transform control button for the current mode should be checked
  • The gizmo handles could be highlighed on hover for clarity
  • The mouse cursor could change to reflect the current tool (Gazebo classic doesn't do this though)

[GUI] [Err] [Ogre2MeshFactory.cc:429] Cannot load null mesh
[GUI] [Err] [Ogre2Visual.cc:59] Cannot attach geometry created by another render-engine
~~~

content.raw:
There are a couple of compile warnings:

~~~
/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/transform_control/TransformControl.cc:84:8: warning: lambda capture 'this' is not used [-Wunused-lambda-capture]
      [this](const ignition::msgs::Boolean &/*_rep*/, const bool _result)
       ^
/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/scene3d/Scene3D.cc:219:12: warning: lambda capture 'this' is not used [-Wunused-lambda-capture]
          [this](const ignition::msgs::Boolean &/*_rep*/, const bool _result)
           ^
~~~
content.html:
There are a couple of compile warnings:

       ^
/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/gui/plugins/scene3d/Scene3D.cc:219:12: warning: lambda capture 'this' is not used [-Wunused-lambda-capture]

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Add support for moving and rotating models

content.raw:
At the moment, this function is returning the "top level" parent, which may not be a model. On Gazebo classic, that's what the [Visual::GetRootVisual](http://gazebosim.org/api/dev/classgazebo_1_1rendering_1_1Visual.html#a3482cd60680141d17631c8deeda2e14d) method returned. I realize that that naming may be confused with `Scene::RootVisual` though. Maybe there's another way we can call it?

This image from [this osrf/gazebo PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1613/) helps a bit:

![](https://bitbucket-assetroot.s3.amazonaws.com/repository/jgXqbo/1543323319-ancestors.png?Signature=eY6JpIz4w0tUQMFF2CJMSOz04z0%3D&Expires=1557767820&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAIQWXW6WLXMB5QZAQ)
content.html:
At the moment, this function is returning the "top level" parent, which may not be a model. On Gazebo classic, that's what the Visual::GetRootVisual method returned. I realize that that naming may be confused with Scene::RootVisual though. Maybe there's another way we can call it?

This image from this osrf/gazebo PR helps a bit:

content.raw: This works great for me too. The only thing I noticed when trying out the example was that if I set the pose of the box and then, while the transform tool is till active, I try to set the pose of another model, the box returns to its original pose. Not sure if that's intentional.
content.html: This works great for me too. The only thing I noticed when trying out the example was that if I set the pose of the box and then, while the transform tool is till active, I try to set the pose of another model, the box returns to its original pose. Not sure if that's intentional.

content.raw: Are we leaking memory here? The protobuf documentation says ownership is transferred to the caller, but I don't see `msg` getting deleted. This is also true for the other commands in this system.
content.html: Are we leaking memory here? The protobuf documentation says ownership is transferred to the caller, but I don't see msg getting deleted. This is also true for the other commands in this system.

* show bounding box when model is selected (requires porting dynamic lines features to ign-rendering)

pullrequest.title: [Blueprint] Add support for moving and rotating models

content.html:
I've been printing req.DebugString() here to help place items for subt, and I noticed that single clicking (no dragging) will generate a request of the form:

name: "staging_area"
position {
}
orientation {
  w: 1
}

Would it be possible or beneficial to only send requests that have moved an object?
